column5: I had an invite to go on some ice with good friends,but was to work. When I arrived at work,I was the only one. So rule one is,no working alone.Was pissed I wasted my day not heading out with them,but I was going to make the best of my day. So,head home, grab my river gear and head out.  I went 1-5.3 were lost in submerged logs,the other was a leap and spit.  Great day for the riv. Met up with a friend and landed this one.   Work forsure wed/thurs,but the temps look good for a friday/saturday riv fish.
No loss there Brian, you saved what started out as a lousy day!

Ya it was a great day to be out Chris.Temps above zero.  And before anyone says,oh your reel in the sand,ya I know.I had to remove the spool and wash it,an all was well again.Love this easy wash and go stuff.HAHAHA   I do have to add,Im getting away from the raven swivels. To many break off at the loop.Not the first time. Not sure what it is? My knots are no dif then any other I tye,and never had an issue.
Well you turned a crappy day around in your favour B.  Good for you.  Nice fish and hey, your reel is in the sand
Nice catch for the end of December from the bank alright .
Ewwwww it looks like it's touching the fish too  You got out Brian...that's the main thing. Thx for sharing.
Gotta put the boots to those things before they make their way into the wood!!!!
Come on down here Brian, I am lonely on the river.  I have Eric Carmen blasting in my ear phones on repeat.
Once I get the hang of how much hold I can do with the rod and line,I maybe able to do that Bill. Im  a 3-5 pound lander for now.    OK, I just did a research on Eric,yer freaking me out now.
Need to put in an order soon phil. Maybe a pick up.
Sure Brian, we are here for ya and for a fish too.
Nice fish, I thought of heading out but wondered about the conditions . You made the right call. And yes sometimes fishing that river feels like your flipping stumps for bass lol R
